It was one of my closest friends' birthday and I happen to mention it to the waiter (who is awesome) and he brought our dessert with a candle and said it was on the house. That was so nice and was very appreciated! For me, the best way to tell about a restaruants seafood is the freshness, especially the poke or ceviche dishes. OUTSTANDING! The chips were perfect and we talked about coming back very soon--and my tacos were the best. Being a local and native, there are tons of taco places but I must say their seafood and the steak tacos were probably my most favorite. I have a will stay a regular!

column4: 115 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: While the bar scene is vibrant, it is much too noisy for the diners who must shout to be heard during dinner. Definitely need a partition to separate bar from dining.We would only return if the weather was such that we could eat outside.
My only complaint would have to be the noise level. About half way through our meal a live jazz band began playing extremely loud music and made our previously enjoyable meal a very unpleasant one.
I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends. And I can't wait to go back.

We have loved this restaurant for lunch, but this was our first time for brunch. Wow! The crab cake eggs Benedict and the colcannon were both outstanding. The service is attentive but not intruding. we stayed a long time and enjoyed it all. try the make your own mimosas!

There was barely anyone at Panta Rei when we arrived, but that spoke nothing of the great food it has to offer. Went for a business lunch on a beautiful day - the outdoor seating is simple, but offers some great people watching in North Beach.

column4: 333 West San Carlos Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: great food, ambiance, fine service, top notch
Fantastic vegetarian/vegan option; delicious!
I always enjoy dining at Paradisio!

Altering their menu decreased the selection and quality of choices. Had to wait for billing process to be completed yet the restaurant was less than half filled. Has taken on the aura of a restaurant in decline, losing badly to its more popular neighbor.

Parcel 104 offered a prix-fixe set menu and price for Thanksgiving @ $50 per person. The sweet pumpkin soup was fabulous. The turkey dinner with tractional sides was fair, but not exceptional. Dessert, a single pie serving, while tasty, was a tiny portion. However, my request to have small tastes of all three pie choices was honored graciously. Service was attentive, friendly and on point. The ambiance is upscale, but a bit stodgy. Not a very lively scene, and the room was more than two thirds empty. I don't think I would spring for $50 per person again for this type of menu. It did not highlight the chef's talents with local produce and innovative recipes.

I understand that the selling point of the $27.50 brunch buffect is bottomless champagne. However, I do hope the restaurant can offer alternative drink choices in lieu of the champagne. Charging customers $8 for a cup of coffee is outrageous.
Copious servings of OK food at a relatively decent price.

column4: 1991 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: My wife and I had dinner at Passage to India for the first time. We were immediately seated, and a waiter came within a minute and took our initial drink order. My wife and I both ordered the buffuet, which was good (not excellent) with the exception of the goat which was outstanding! We both enjoyed the food choices and flavors - we really enjoyed the Garlic Naan. Definitely a place we'll come back to.

column4: 315 Main St. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Fabulous as always! LOVE the lasagna! Great for lunch or dinner. Wonderful staff who is pleasant to everyone. Pasta Moon will continue to be on the top of our list.

column4: 3124 Crow Canyon Place San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Have been going here for over twenty years and never ever disappointed. It is our special occassions restaurant and for those nights we need a quiet get away where we can talk, eat wonderful food, drink great wine, have attentive service with little special surprizes.

It was nice that the Owner/Manager walks around the restaurant and makes sure that the guests are happy. Food was excellent, all our our meat selections were cooked to perfection. Our waiter wasn't quite as friendly as we would like and she was unable/willing to assist on menu recommendations. A nice touch was the 20% off our next visit that was presented upon our exit.

I took my brother for his 1st stripclub expirience, he fell inlove. Food was great service was nice but not familiar w menu. I was told they lost power and most of there food was spoiled including all the Kobe which I was looking forwards too.
Good food and good service, very friendly people.

The salumi misti was out of this world . . . the small plate perfect for two people to share and savor. Every bite was delicious, from beginning to end. On a Friday night the place was packed like sardines, so do make a reservation. The butternut squash raviora was heavenly. The herb-crusted beef short ribs wereso tender and melt-in-your-mouth divine! This is not your ordinary Italian restaurant . . . it harkens back to real Italy.

Wonderful. So glad they were open Thanksgiving. And the staff seemed to enjoy being there and that made the experience more enjoyable. Food was as delicious as usual.So Thankful For Perry's on holidays!

I have been dining at Perry's since I moved to SF 45 years ago. It's a consistant'stable' place to go. Food remains of high quality; staff are welcoming; service is quick but not pushy; they allow you time to chat & choose your meal.
GREAT FOOD AND GOOD SERVICE, KUDOS TO THE TWO ASIAN WAITERS THAT SERVICED US.
Loved it, needed vegan options and there were plenty as well as amazing pizza and meat options...

The fried calamari was perfect---tender, crispy, with a light, almost tempura-like coating. I asked for a side of cole slaw, which was not listed on the menu (but they did have cole slaw listed with other dishes) and it too was delicious. Just thinking about it today makes me want to go back and order the same thing again !
Wonderful wait staff; giving privacy with service at the same time. Lovely ambiance.
1. When I called for reservations I was told that dinner would be 25 or 26 $. It was 30. Food was almost cold. Over priced.Server did a good job.

A wonderful meal..Eclectic....pizza...(perfect crust), shared pasta (bolognese) AND ahi tuna to please any palate....Quiet on the patio away from the noise of the main dining area...service attentive yet subtleA most pleasant evening...thank you

Authentic Italian food and staff and ambiance. Reminded me of being in Italy. Excellent lobster ravioli in tomato cream sauce. Wish they had more wine by the glass selection, but otherwise great experience
Brunch not as good as lunch on my previous visit. Server pleasant but forgot some dishes.

Always mildly amused when I enter the restaurant. It is as if I walk out of an arousing urbanized existence and then seamlessly launched into an adaptation of, "The Stepford Wives". The patrons tend to be plastic and proud and the waitstaff, at times, displays a certain hostility. Presumably, the staff has its fair share of lordliness with which to deal; but for the price to be entertained at Picco, one would think the staff would be better equipped. The food, however, is the most interesting and memorable part of the evening. It is the simplicity of the fresh Kampachi and the variation of the risotto that keeps me coming back. The cocktails once outstanding, but as of late syrupy. Despite it all...did I mention the delicious cuisine?
Secluded location -in an intimate but vibrant atmosphere. Our second visit was as good as our first. We'll be back!

column4: Pier 3, The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Friendly people and good tasting food.

Had the bean soup, good but very salty, the scallops, way too much spinach and capers, and the panna cotta, where they obtained peaches to grill and strawberries that were "fresh & locally sourced" is a concern because the peaches were hard as rocks and both peaches and strawberries were tasteless.
Celebrated my wifes birthday here staff were fab food spot on a view to remember table near the window with Alcatrz view, top night great staff will deffo go again when in town. Steve from UK
Our family celebrated my daughter's 21st Birthday and we had a memorable experience at the Plaza Bistro! We definetely will go back again! Sincerely, Katerina

I've been a pretty faithful customer of Poesia since it opened several years ago. Unlike many restaurants that don't seem to maintain a good standard of food or a diversity of options, Poesia has consistently maintained high standards of food and a diverse, often changing menu. I have always had great meals at Poesia and I highly recommend this restaurant.
Interesting menu. Fish skin was charred, although it was deboned at the table in a competent manner.. House-made pasta tough. Plleasant setting.
Overall experience was great the hostest was excellent I came out for my birthday and I was not dissaspointed great foid drinks

column1: Porter's Restaurant - Poppy Ridge Golf Course
column13: Loved the quite, peaceful view. Food was excellent but the service was poor. I would wait a while before returning to this lovely spot until the service may get better.
great local place if you are in the redwood city area

We had a wonderful meal; service was impeccable; we were "troublesome" so she earned her money.Making requests for things off the menu and splitting an entree for an appetizer at a table of four. I'llbe surprised if we're let back in...LOL. Fantastic!! Love the restaurant, staff and food.

column4: 1801 E. Cotati Ave Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Foot tasty, ambiance quite nice, service odd. Delivery of wine and food was not well timed. White wine arrived with first course (crab cakes) a few minutes later while still eating the crab cakes, the red wine was delivered ahead of the 2nd course. Within five minutes of that course arriving, while I was still eating and had plenty of food on the plate, I was asked if I was ready for the desert menu. Server was vrery nice and wanted to please but needs more practice with timin.
Amaizing place. exellent service but this time the french toast was dry. but we will be there again for sure.

The chips are fabulous! Very different than your normal tortilla chip. It always seems to be too busy at dinner time though, the servers seem like they are spread too thin and don't have enough people on the floor. The salads are huge and the only reason I go there.
Attentive staff and great atmosphere. Food was delicious and the ingredients were fresh. Great coffee!

This is a great family restaurant. They really know their food and their cerviche dishes are truly wonderful. Somehow I never seem to get beyond the appetizers as I order a bunch to share, to get the variety of flavors on offer.

My partner and I really loved Radish. Delish, fresh, interesting food and GREAT service; Katie, our server/bartender was friendly and in addition to gave us great tips about the city, in addition to sound suggestions on what to order.
Brunch Chef Michael Ocampo created some amazing brunch dishes...I would definitely recommend brunch here. Everything was unique and very tasty! I will be back!
Finally an ethnic restaurant that can make the food really spicy (and still tasty) if you want it that way.

column4: 7335 Bollinger Road Unit C Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: Had not dined at The Red Crane for a few months, and were quite happy to have returned. New dishes had been added to Royce's signature dishes. All show signs of Royce's creativity and light touch. Always enjoy his Wasabi Caesar Salad and Mushroom Pizza. Added Chicken Gyoza, Crab Bites, Hamachi Sashimi and Miso Glazed Chicken to the mix. Quite a variety! Modest, but well constructed wine list, plus a few sakes we're still learning about.

A little gem at the end of Claremont Ave. Easy parking, great menu and perfect recommendations. Our server suggested bringing the dishes in a family style plate which was great for browsingall of the items in an easy, fun format.

You won't go away hungry. The Red Tavern features many regional specialties from Russia, Bulgaria and even some middle eastern dishes. Food is heavy, but tasty. Not everyday for me, but when in the mood for smoked fish, borscht, stroganoff or dumplings. They do great things with potatoes.
Great food and nice server, but the set up is awkward when walking in and the wait was long, even with reservations.
Great tasting food and excellent service. The ribs were unbelievable, both tender and tasty. The chicken enchiladas were also excellent, as well as the churros y chocolate dessert.

Great location - easy to find. Plenty of large screen TVs good for sports fans. First time dining at The Republic - it was a Tuesday night and fairly empty yet the service was quite slow (15-minutes to get a vodka Martini even though there were no customers at the bar and the bar was 10 ft. away from our table). Perhaps there was a private party elsewhere in the building? Generous portions. Turkey burger was served dry and some condiments (an aioli maybe) would have made for a much more flavorful burger. The salmon on the salmon sandwich was quite fishy tasting. The best part of our dining experience? The french fries. Other than that I would not go out of my way to return.

column4: 303 N Santa Cruz Ave Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: The food was very good however, our Server was not.
Very good food and attentive service - enjoyed it very much.
Exemplary service and food - their Lava cake for dessert was delicious. They even surprised us with a "painted" anniversary surprise.
The service was excellent !! Food was wonderful and good value . No complaints

We enjoy our meals and service each time we dine at Ristorante Bella Vita in Los Altos. It is convenient and off the main street so it is always easy to find parking. The decor and ambiance is always a nice feature. The restaurant is comfortable for both couples and groups, as they are able to accommodate with their separate rooms and one day we plan to make us of their beautiful wine room for a special occasion or party. We invited friends to join us and it is was their first time eating here - they too are from Los Altos but had never giving the restaurant a try - they enjoyed it and will be back!

This was the most disappointing of our many visits to Da Mario. Three of our party of 5 thought that the food was only OK. Two of them had mushroom ravioli and the third a chicken parmigiana. The other two of us thought the food we ordered, veal scallapini and the rockfish special, was very good. The service was very good, as usual. The prices at this restaurant are higher than similar restaurants in Saratoga. The food should be outstanding.
Very professional and personal service, the owner takes the time to give his own personal touch to everything. I will highly recommend it to others as well.

Restorante Milano is a great addition to the Russian Hill (just off Hyde Street) restaurants. Menu was focused on Northern Italian (i.e. Milano) food style and delivered. Overall food and service was excellent and price reasonable for selection. I would recommend it highly to all that love the Russian Hill experience. After dinner, walk back up the hill to Hyde and take the cable car home!

This Emeryville gem is kind of hidden off the street, but the food is well worth the search. To be honest, I chose Riva Cucina for the panna cotta, but I'll be returning for the rest of the menu. The service was excellent, and the help with the wine choice was appreciated.
Sea Bass was slightly overcooked, but still edible.
Rivoli is always a great spot for a romantic dinner!
always good food and good service

The host is always gracious and accomodating; and helps servers when needed. We brouht out of town guests and our party of six had a very enjoyable dinner. Service was excellent and the food was outstanding. We were just here two weeks ago and had the same experience.

AMAZING!!!! From the garlicky oil dip to the succlulect prawns (and there were plenty of them), to the wine and the sandwiches, all fantastic!And fair prices to boot! You will be very happy in this cozy little neighborhoood gem.

A fun place for beer and good American food. Nothing fancy, but tasty and plentiful. If you like beer, they always have a good selection of beers made on the premises. I had a delicious turkey meatloaf, and my husband enjoyed his burger.
We had dinner there last weekend. We enjoyed the casual ambiance but the food was not good. There was something wrong with every dish we ordered. Do they not taste the food they serve there?
2nd time we've been here. Excellent food and service. A welcome departure from the traditional experience.
Consistently top notch food and service; non-pretentious
Great food, great service, delightful place!!

column4: 53 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Still one of the best neigborhood Indian restaurants!

column1: The Rotunda at Neiman Marcus - San Francisco
column13: Great place for a girlfriend lunch. Beautiful, with great food and service. Pricey, but hey, everyone needs a little treat once in a while.
Food and portions are decent for the price.
the food and service were excellent.
The lamb skewer and beet salad were fantastic. Excellent service and decor. The entree's were good but not great. I think I will return for a second chance as our experience their was great.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
column4: 1601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Hands down, the best fillet I've ever had and the shrimp was perfect. Celebrating a friend's birthday was our special occasion and the wait staff made it very memorable in discrete sophisticated way.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Walnut Creek
column4: 1553 Olympic Blvd. Bldg. E Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: I did not receive my points for this reservation. Could you please give them to me?

column4: 1143 San Carlos Ave. San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: The food was delicious - I lived in India and this is great Indian food! We had veg and non-veg dishes and they were all amazing. It arrived piping hot to the table and we had very attentive service. My friends had been here several times but this was my first time and I will definitely go back.

column4: 1075 Sutter Street Hotel Carlton San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: A less than stunning room - sets the tone for something straightforward, not fancy. We trusted our server to guide us to choose what was a wow. The flavors were strong - but we felt it was more show and spice - more than that depth of flavor. Great beer choices.

My all time best restaurant experience! The 18 course menu was thoughtfully planned; courses flowed organically into the next and were perfectly proportioned to leave you nourished and sated yet comfortable. Each dish was a work of art: fresh, tasty and visually arresting. Interesting combinations surprised and delighted me such as a dish called "toffee", a mousse made of duck-liver and white chocolate paired with a Bavarian Lager. Seemingly simple dishes such as a bowl of vegetables eaten with your fingers successfully stood next to more complex preparations of pork, ash and who knows what else! Excellent pairings were served throughout introducing me to wines that I would enjoy with or without food.

Even though we had a reservation, we were seated a half hour late because it was Diwali. The hostess was completely frazzled and did not manage the crowd well. The manager was more in control and settled things down quickly. Food was good, both quality and variety.
Always reliable. Delicious, authentic afghan food in generous portions. A good value.

The only restaurant that has worse service than Salt House is R&G Lounge on Kearny. Tables were placed so tightly some of us were sitting with their backs touching the people at the next table. Didn't help that the five of us were given a table for 4. The waiter took away the Shellfish Plateau tray before we could finish all the oysters. We were given the bill - not in a tray or in a folder, just the piece of paper - while we were still having the dessert. The waitress never once came to check if everything was ok.

I have been a loyal fan of Salute E Vita Ristorante for years. After being away, I was eager to have a meal there. I've now been twice, and both times were a big disappointment. The place was over-crowded and the noise was horrific. We had to wait for over an hour from the time we ordered until our meal came. The second time was for Thanksgiving. The wait staff mixed up our orders and served two of us the wrong meal, we had to ask over and over for water, all the white pieces of turkey were dry as a bone and tasteless, though the dark meat was fine, and again it was so incredibly loud we couldn't talk. It was such a disappointment that I doubt I'll go back. The staff are friendly and the ambiance is lovely - but...

A little nerve-wracking to have to fight the large gulls, but well worth the battle. Picturesque, uniquq to the Bay area, the food, setting and service made this a memorable meal to share with family we don't get to see very often. Fun to watch kayakers come up from the dock to share a meal and warm up, too.

I made the reservation but was the last one to arrive. My friends were so impressed that they were greeted like a VIP and seated right away. The food was always a treat. Some of my friends came to Livermore for the first time. They were pleasantly surprised with the lunch experience and the downtown.

column1: Santé at the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn
column13: This is a very special place. Loved it!

I had my eye on this restaurant for awhile since I love Greek food, but only recently had the occasion to eat there. It was a pleasant meal but not as traditional Greek as I had hoped. The Greek salad had fresh greens but had few tomatoes or olives and just a sprinking of feta. The gyro meat was delicious and the pita bread was light and tasty. The tsadziki sauce was milder than I like. There were two musicians who quietly played songs to accompany the dinner and I enjoyed that added touch. It's a good place to have a pre-theater meal as long as you aren't expecting it to be a traditional Greek restaurant.

column4: 105 Town and Country Drive Danville, CA  94526
column13: All of the lamb dishes are wonderful. Service is very good and you never feel rushed. Indoor and outdoor dining available. Parking is plentiful.

Very good pasta. Good service. A little hectic for a lunch since a San Mateo women's group was seated on the entire ground floor and seemed intent on shouting over each other. Hut it was a nice place for a sit down lunch.

This restaurant, in a strip mall, has no ambiance at all. However, the food is good, fresh, plentiful, made to order, and reasonably priced. The service is friendly and attentive. This is obviously a family owned and run operation. The people are working hard to provide good fresh food to please their patrons and make a success of their restaurant
I have been there twice now and it's my new favorite place. We had a great server on Black Friday, and they played a fun discount game. The food was absolutely fantastic! Can't wait to go back!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Unfortunately, Sauce has a recurring issue that they need to resolve before I'll be back. When arriving with my group of 7, we noticed that the menu stated that "gratuity included on parties of 6 or more." After paying our check, we were at the stoplight at the end of the street when the server ran down to us apologizing that we hadn't left a tip. When I advised that the menu stated it would be included, she said that the menu stated "gratuity MAY be included." After I added the tip to the receipt on the hood of a nearby car, my party recalled that a Sauce server had done this same exact thing when we were here 6 months ago. This was embarrassing for us and the server. Note to Sauce: Either include the tip or remove the notice on the menu

Since it's a newer place, it looks like they are still working out all kinks due to their popularity. For example, a few false starts with our being seated by a hostess. At the table, we got menus and water quickly, but there was a wait for our order to be taken. Folks around us were having a good time, and we chatted with nearby customers. The brisket was good, but very spicy, not noted on the menu. It cleared the sinuses. The waitress said it was dry rub. My jive turkey was tasty, and moist with the BBQ sauces. The fried Oreos were interesting, would have liked a few more. All in all, a fun place that we would go back to and try sitting outside where it was quieter.

We arrived a few minutes late,but our friends arrived on time and were told that there was no reservation for us, so they left. When I arrived I tried to check in with someone, but nobody understood what Open Table is. There was no manager on duty. The food was less than ok, the polenta was not edible, and the service was ok. The only good part was the really good band.
The price of the food is reasonable for the portion size and quality of food. It is a friendly and relaxed environment.
Excellent place. We just google a good restaurant in the area and we were so delighted. What a surprise! Excellent food, the best Peruvian food we have eaten and we have been on Peru.
We took out of town guests to dinner before a ACT play. The waiter was helpful in suggesting itemss on the menu. Pizzas, risotto, soup,salads...everything was fresh and flavorful.

Very good experience at Scoma's on the night after Thanksgiving. Got seated right away, waitress was quick and attentive and answered any questuions we had. Food was quite excellent, which surprised me for a touristy type of place.

column4: 1333 North California Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Love the ambiance and the live piano music is a special treat. Always good food, too.

I love the holiday spirit when we went there on Nov 26 - the restaurant was decorated for the holidays and all the lights and looking out at the water was very festive and made the evening feel special. The food here is always great - I had the herb-crusted ahi with vegetables and we split the crabcake appetizer - both were delicious and the sauce on the ahi was so amazing we were dipping the crabcakes and bread in it! The server and wait staff was very attentive.
Excellent meal and ,for the most part, good service and ambiance.

column1: Scott's Seafood Mountain View (fka The Cantankerous Fish)
column13: This is a fine, medium-price restaurant, with good food. I'm a true foodie, and it wasn't special, but worked for us when we needed to go out to dinner while visiting Mountain View.
A bit pricey for the small portion sizes, although the food was delicious. Very upscale feel.

We dined in the eve and it was so cold had to keep jacket on and then added my scarf. The risotto was good but luke warm and the beet salad, while once delicious now is mediocre. should go back to their recipe of the beet stack. I have eaten here about 25 times and this was the poorest experience
Food and service were great. It was Thanksgiving and we made our reservation for when it opened so I can only judge what occurred early in the day.
Chicken was dry and overcooked unlike last visit where chicken was delicious. Hope this was a one time event.

column1: Seasons at the Four Seasons Hotel
column4: 757 Market St. Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: We dine at the Seasons for breakfast on a regular basis. All agree, it is our favorite meal of the week. Excellent staff and great food.

Dining at Sens is always an absolute delight. It's very spacious and the food isalways delicious. It's a real treat to introduce anyone who's not been here orfor someone who wants to come again. I have never been disappointd with a meal.
Interesting wine list with some small (and virtually unknown) producers definately worth discovering! Good selection of by the glass wines too.

I have been to Serpentine several times. Even though parking situation can be maddening, the food from this restaurant is worth the trip. The pork sandwich is a favorite of mine. The ingredients used at Sepentine appear to be fresh, local when possible. One can find warmth in their soups on a cold, rainy San Francisco day. This place is a solid lunch option for those able to travel to Dog Patch during the work day.

Wonderful experience at seven hills. It was our anniversary and they gave us a table up front. Smaller plates with each one more delicious than the last. Menu items were reasonably prices and so different and yummy. Wine list interesting and reasonable. Terrific service. Small spot and cozy but a night to remember. Highly recommended.
Very small restaurant, great food, slow service but since the place is so small you can stay the whole evening.

column4: 1080 S. De Anza Blvd. San Jose, CA  95129
column13: My husband and I recently discovered Siam. We loved it. Great food and reasonable prices. We will definitely be back - again, and again!

Everything about Siena Bistro was wonderful from the moment we walked through the door and were greeted by name (we were the only table left to be seated) to the fact that they accommodated our rushed schedule with aplomb and graciousness. All 4 of our meals were excellent and the wine we chose was great. They suggested returning after our concert but we already had dessert plans. However, we can't wait to go back with more time and do justice to this great find (and sample their desserts).

column1: Silver Clouds Restaurant and Karaoke Bar
column13: The restaurant was clean but the service was very slow. They ran out of baked potato's and the fish tasted like dish soap. We had a big group of people and they would not split our check and gave us a hand written ticket that we could barely read and a calculator.
Great vegetarian options. My wife & I were full after one cheese fondue - we had them spice it up for us. The pecan chocolate desert fondue was even better. We used a Groupon deal.

Arriving for our 6pm res for a party of 6, the hostess said "ok". I wasn't sure what "ok" meant, so I kept looking at her, she gave a sly smile and said, "it will be a few minutes". I was a little disappointed that our confirmed table was not ready. When she went to seat us, 10 min later, the booth was extremely small and set for a 5 top! I asked the hostess if there was a coat check and she said she could take my jacket up front. When I handed it to her she touched it like it was covered in gas. She then threw down another setting on the table and come to find out upon leaving, wadded up my jacket on the floor at the hostess stand. Christina, our server was fortunately OUTSTANDING very nice and helpful with the table issue.
Very fresh flavorful food. Loved the use of tomatoes in the Korma. Good casual dining.

I've been to skool many times, and every time i have the same complaint: the large open room can make overly noisy groups nearly intolerable. We had 7 at our table and next to us was a standing table of 10+. Their noise level absolutely dominated the restaurant, and because they were directly next to us, we were barely able to hear each other. As time went on and more shots went down, they got noisier and more obnoxious. It's frustrating to spend nearly $500 on dinner and have the atmosphere ruined by a bunch of inconsiderate people, and not have the staff intervene at all. Other tables were clearly annoyed by the same group. That's the only negative mark. The food was spectacular as usual, as was our service. The uni flan rules.
Dishes had great flavor combinations. Really enjoyed the mussels, short ribs and salmon. Martinis were perfect. Service by Christy was exceptional.

We were recieved with a very welcoming attitude. We were a group of 6 and seated in the side room (enclosed outside). Everyone made us feel very much at home. The food was very good and we shared many different starters. Our waiter was very informative and gracious.All of us being in the wine industry appreciate such professional service.We laughed and talked and felt we were we not disturbing others. I would recommend this place for a relaxed evening gathering with friends.
Great Mediterranean cuisine near the Metreon. Restaurant is attached to a hotel, even though it has it's own entrance. Ambiance is OK.

The food is very good, service friendly, atmosphere OK, but the price is really up there. Our meal was over $400 (and would have been higher if we had chosen the wine paring). For this price we could have gone to Fifth Floor, Gary Danko or La Folie. I have no regrets for trying the restaurant, but thought the price was a little high for the overall experience.

column4: 417 South California Avenue Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Went for a Thanksgiving meal in the early evening and they did a very nice job with food and service. It was a special T-giving menu - we had turkey and fixings. Nothing unusual but well done. Service was very cordial - they did not rush us. Its a very pleasant place and I would go again and recommend it.
When trying to decide where to eat, remember Spasso's.They offer friendly service, nice atmosphere, and excellent food.You can't go wrong.
Had polenta cakes with butter and anchovy sauce for appetizer. It was warm and delicious.
The appetizer specials were especially good: mushroom leek soup, escargot, salmon, potato pancakes!! Rye bread--awesome.

column4: DoubleTree by Hilton San Jose 2050 Gateway Place 2050 Gateway Place San Jose, CA  95110
column13: Started with iceberg lettuce with tomatoes n bacon. We changed d blue cheese viniagrette dressing 2 Ranch. There were 3 entree selections for d Thanksgiving menu : steak, turkey or prime rib. My husband n I both chose d prime rib. I requested 4 d end cut as I prefer my meat well done (no blood) but it came out pretty red. Server brought it back n came back with an amazing piece of prime rib to my liking. Dessert was pumpkin pie which my husband and son loved! Had 2 glasses of moscato d' Asti which were delicious! No kids menu but we ordered our boy pasta tossed in olive oil with cheese on top. He loved it.

Spenger's is an historic landmark. The menu is varied enough to allow you to take even the pickiest eater, yet stays true to its roots as a seafood mainstay. The wait staff is always attentive and they know the menu backwards and forwards as well as the history of this 125 year old establishment. While we don't live in the Bay Area any more, we try to visit Spenger's at least once each trip. It is reasonable, good, and the current owners refrained from turning it into a mirror image of chain restaurant sterility. We loved it.

column4: 33 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Very friendly and attentive staff. Great food.
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco! The staff are so cool and helpful and the food and wine is always amazing!
This was our second visit to Spruce and we will be returning. The service is wonderful as is the food. A lovely experience.
my favorite place to eat in Livermore area.

My husband and I have been here several times and always really enjoy the food, the ambiance and especially the service. We brought my parents visiting from out of town and were seated in the back dining room, over 2 heaters. I normally wouldn't have complained about this, but combined with the small slanted-roofed room and my vertigo, I was feeling dizzy and off balance. We requested to move even just away from the heaters and preferably into the main room, but they could not - would not - move us to another available table. The gentleman who told us we wouldn't be able to move was less than accommodating nor understanding. In the future, when I make my reservations I will specify which room I'd like to sit in.
Delicious food, but small portions for what you pay.

column4: 333 Santana Row, Suite #1100 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: I had a great experience at Straits Restaurant. They have a nice bar lounge (Happy Hour M-F,3-6), a romantic dining area and outdoor dining as well. Great restaurant for a first date!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: I love the idea of this place but the execution was poor. The seats were ridiculously uncomfortable and half of our party was basically sitting on a ledge not a bench. When I take the time to make a reservation, nobody wants to be sitting with walls screws grinding into their back! The appetizers were very good and we looked forward to our main dishes but were deeply unimpressed. The veggie chili was cloyingly sweet. The burger was overdone. The tuna was good but that was the only main dish liked at our table! The place has potential but needs a lot of work. It would take a bit of work to get any of us back.

7pm on a wednesday night and we were the only people in the place, the food was very good and parts in very generous portions. A few more people and it would be a very good place to eat. I would recommend it to most of my friends.

column4: 1149 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Our favorite neighborhood restaurant with excellent authentic Turkish cuisine. The wine list, although not extensive, is very good with Turkish and California selections.

Very cool restaurant, modern interior with a decent sized bar. The food was excellent and fast. We had a weird situation where half of our table ordered 5 min. before the other half of the table so our food came at different times which I thought was kind of strange. However, they realized the mistake and brought us free dessert afterwards! Overall, very delicious food and a fun place to eat/get a drink. Will definitely be coming back for happy hour!
The worst sashimi I had in a long time. Very thick slices of tasteless fish!
No complaints with the food, but the service seems to be getting worse with each visit.

Sushi Ran is simply my favorite restaurant in the Bay Area. Yoshi, the owner, makes Sushi Ran so excellent, with his high standards and warm presence. Scott, the chef, is always working on the menu to make sure everything is perfect. Even when you think an item on the menu is the best--they will make a little tweak to make it even better, and even more interesting, or add a new menu item that is amazing--like the brussel sprouts right now. I have been eating at Sushi Ran for 2 decades and the quality of their delicious food and professional service has always been at the top.

column4: 1090 Point Lobos Ave. San Francisco, CA  94121
column13: Since we were there last time about a year ago it seems like the restaurant replaced the chef cook because the food differs as day and night. Menu was short and very restrictive in choice. Short ribs tasted like they were prepared a week ago and just warmed up before serving. Seabass was dry and tasteless. So overall impression from the food was unpleasant.
I like the omelet station, pasta station and the overall variety. The service was very good and the music is always a nice touch.

Food was nothing short of fantastic. We started with potato wedges and the lentil soup along with house-made sodas: lemon-lime and huckleberry. Potatoes were perfectly crispy and came with a sour cream/dill dipping sauce. Lentil soup was the best we'd ever had. The sodas were truly unique...refreshing and not too sweet. Next was a roasted beet salad with persimmon jam...yum! Next was grilled calamari...buttery tender with a smoky flavor. Finally, we had rabbit fritters...they were the bomb! Perfectly cooked to a golden brown, with the rabbit being absolutely succulent. We finished with a lovely pumpkin cheesecake and excellent French-press coffee. Everything was incredible and we will DEFINITELY be going back soon!
Service is lacking: slow and asked us to reuse our silverware for main course.
Good Indian food, not too spicy, but you can always request more heat. Service is efficient and friendly. They have live music a few nights per week. We'll definitely go back.

I hadn't been here in several years and after taking the first bites, I have no idea why. Everything was absolutely delicious, from the Shaking Beef, to the Hoisin Lamb Chops, to the Empress Rice. Service was top notch, as was pretty everything else. I guarantee I will be back again soon this time.
Great Southeast Asian food (I personally like the Thai selections) served quickly with good service. I like the Thai service standard and the fast service during my workday lunch hour.
Had the Thanksgiving dinner and loved it!!! We're quickly becoming regulars here. All of the holiday meals have been absolutely perfect :)
This place was boarded up tight as a drum. It appears to be out of business. You should remove it from your site.
wow - for Thanksgiving dinner it doesn't get better than this! Great service and superb food and we felt like guests in a gracious setting, not like anonymous diners in a restaurant.

column4: 5800 Nave Drive Suite C Novato, CA  94949
column13: Excellent food & service. Dining room was attractive enough, but the layout could use some work. Italian only wine list was an interesting twist. We really enjoyed our dinner and will be back.

This great restaurant is in a stip mall.. but service, ambience and food were unexpectedly superb! True Italian style restaurant with all men waiters, excellent service and good food. Huge fireplace in room and dim lighting made for a nice romantic dinner. Request table for 2 next to fireplace when you make reservations!

column1: Terrace Cafe and Veranda Bar - Best Western El Rancho Inn
column13: This is a passable place for what it is... a place to park your car for an early flight. The meals are better than I remember years ago, but not a place I would recommend unless a car is not available. Drinks in bar are sosso..The breakfast bar is much better than it was in the past...but not a full meal and the usual carb fest. It served us well though......would go again...
Interior design ****Music playlist ****

column4: 255 N. First Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Service is slow and cost is a bit expensive. The food is fresh and of good quality, but dry. The apple strudel and homemade noodles were excellent. Pork shank is an excellent choice. Large selection of beer. Noisy. Full bar available with large screen TVs.

Feels like maybe they are still getting it together. The Burger was dry and the Lamb was good but not super flavorful. This place has such potential and a great vibe. Still need to work on the food quality.
Food was decent but nothing to write home about...prices were moderate although could be lower in some cases. Spinach salad and minestrone soup were highlights.
Great service and great comfort food make this a local gem. The large street-side patio and live music make it a great spot for locals.

The server at the Tipsy Pig on the evening before Thanksgiving was exceptionally good. He was helpful with beer recommendations and he let me know that the osso bucco would be salty because it was prepared using brine. So I ordered the chicken pot pie, which was quite good, and my husband liked the fish and chips. The other four people at our table also enjoyed their dinners. The noise level was not as loud as expected since we were in the back room and not close to the bar in front. I searched a long time on the web to find a good gastropub and this one was a great choice.

column4: Number One Nob Hill San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: In town for only a couple of days and this is the perfect spot to experience the heart of San Francisco. Thank you!

I would highly recommend Town Hall for a romantic dinner as well as a dinner with friends. The space was beautiful with high ceilings and dark wood, the lighting was dim but not too dark, the vibe was energetic, and there was a good mix of both young professionals and old establishment. The mixed drinks were fresh, and the food was fantastic. My husband and I split a dinner and a number of appetizers and they were all seasonal, flavorful and delicious.
consistent restaurant, good quality food.

I didn't enjoy our visit As much this time. We usually have gret food and gret choices but the menu just seemed a bit lacking this time. Wew always have great food here, and I would recommend it without hesitation but just didn't have as great an experience this time.
steak was a bit dry. presentation was not great. neither was service.

Glad I made a reservation because this restaurant was packed on Sunday night. The service was attentive and our waiter courteous. One small criticism is that water glasses could have been refilled more quickly. A nice selection of wine. The food was plated in a simple rustic fashion. Each member of my party ordered a starter, main, and dessert, and we were raving about each course as we were eating. The highlight had to have been the flourless chocolate cake, but all of the dishes had balance and were artfully prepared. It's not within my budget to eat at Corso regularly, but it is definitely a restaurant for celebrating a special occasion.
Nice neighborhood restaurant. Small menu, but quality ingredients prepared nicely and very tasty.

column4: 1077 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: First time the food was cold. We went back and it was great. Stuff happens as they were short handed and busy. We still love it here.
We four agreed the food was ample, very tasty and the service was terrific. We'll be back!
The food was excellent and the service was great. Wonderful outdoor dining spot. Highly recommended.

I was so disappointed with this place. The food was bland and generally not good and the service was slow. I could have forgiven the slow service if the food had been good. I probably should not have gone for dinner and tried brunch instead. It was raining the night I went, but it looked like they had a nice back patio. I can't imagine I would go back. They had art from local artists displayed. This was a nice touch.

column4: 75 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: I chose to make a reservation here based on location and other reviews. It did not dissappoint! I enjoyed the salmon dish very much as did my date. I'll likely return to this venue in the near future and definitely recommend it.
Great food and service. I highly recommend!

I have been to TROYA now a handful of times, and every time I leave completely satisfied. The food is so fresh and full of amazing flavor that even when you are full you don't want to stop eating. The Bayti is a MUST try, and the Happy Hour menu is delicious and quite extensive.
fun and appetizing rolls, interesting descriptions, helpful server, fun night out.

not enough wait staff..the lull between courses was way too long which made our meal not an pleasant experience. Had to ask for water, tea and more wasbi more than twice and still had to get up ourselves to get the extra wasbi. the sushi was quite good though very pricey for rolls but our living social coupon helped..we tried it which was the goal but not to return.
This is a great neighborhood find (value, ambiance, and service).
Great for kids. Great happy hour deals. Great value.
Uncle Yu's has never failed us. Excellent dining experience everytime!!

The food is pretty good. The wines, eh. I like the concept of value wine, but there is a lot of good tasting wine out there for a value. I feel like they could do a better job mixing it up and providing it! I think this is a good spot to go to when you are done wine tasting in the area and want to grab some bites and finish off the day. The outside patio is awesome.

column1: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
column13: Out of way too many things on the wine list....
Food and staff was great. No table service.....order food at the counter and it is brought to you. Not what I expected. No alcohol but you can bring your own wine.

column4: Hilton San Francisco 333 O'Farrell St. San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: Thanksgiving meal - food was mediocre, there was no choice other than turkey so one of our party couldn't eat as they would not offer any alternative.Service was slow.Over priced rubbish
Except for the salumi platter the entrees were so-so. I ordered their wild boar ragu pasta there was no flavor at all. And for dessert the chocolate cake tasted like store bought.

We were in Napa for a girls' weekend visiting from Minnesota. Uva was recommended to us by a few different people and we decided to give it a try. Adam, our server, was great and the food was awesome! It was a great night during our first visit to Napa

column1: Va de Vi Bistro & Wine Bar
column4: 1511 Mt. Diablo Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: An exceptional dining experience. Highlights were the cod, the lechon and the shot of spicy carrot soup! An admirable wine list. An attentive server.

column4: 164 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Although the server was good the food was just okay. We ordered an appetizer of tuna tartare and actually it was pretty tasteless. We should have sent it back. I ordered a special pasta dish with mussels and shrimp in a spicy tomato sauce and it was good. I think the best part of the meal was their brussel sprout chips. I do not think I will go back any time soon.

Lovely hidden gem in San Francisco - and worth a trip to Bernal Heights.Warm inviting interior, gracious and unpretentious service, (Roberto is fabulous) this small restaurant is one of my favorites in all the city.Real Italian food by real Italians.The kind of food that fills the soul and heart.
Great food and a great Thanksgiving dinner.
It was so nice to walk in on a cool autumn evening and find a very, very seasonal menu: winter squash, persimmons, kale. A really lovely meal!
Israel has put some excellent meals out for the past 7 years, we love to go back. Warm, welcoming place. No Corkage
We have found service and food to be both consistently excellent. The staff is very professional, yet personable. The food is incredible. We've eaten here 3 or 4 times now, and it's a favorite.
I will be coming back to Villa D'Este. Excellent ambience, excellent prices, good food. Great neighborhood gem...
Good food, delicious wine & good service.
Fourth time at VP, and still impressed with the whole experience. One of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area!
My friend & I dined here for Thanksgiving. I was looking for someplace that served some organic foods. We drove all the way from the peninsula.
The food was amazing and the service was also. I can't wait to go back.

column1: Vineyards Chop House - Crowne Plaza Hotel Concord
column13: Have been here a few times for the service and food. This time was not good...service was horrid so my girlfriend and I left before even getting menus. There was a wedding going on in the open area, so the noise was terriable too, so this was just a bump in the road, so I will go back...

column1: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
column4: 125 Third Street 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Decent brunch for SF but on the expensive side. A glass of OJ for $9 is a bit crazy. One in my party (of 5) ordered the eggs benedict in which the egg was overcooked. The yoke was solid hard as opposed to "oozy" which is a big deal if Vitrine is trying to be a higher end brunch/breakfast place. That's the only food complaint as the other entrees were pretty good. Service was good at the start, but has room for improvement. After the waiter took my credit card to charge, the wait was a bit long considering it was not a packed house (over 5 minutes). If you can afford to pay $20+ per person for an above average breakfast + 2 times what you normally should pay for drinks, go for it.
This is our favorite restaurant. We go there frequently and are never disappointed.
Good atmosphere, but food was nothing special. The papaya salad was bland. Overall there wasn't much to distinguish it from any other asian restaurant.

column4: 399 The Embarcadero South San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: Awsome location.

column4: 3143 Stevens Creek Blvd San Jose, CA  95117
column13: excellent mussels in herb sauce, tender almond crusted salmon, interesting papaya steak salad appetizer bursting with flavor, and an awesome dessert sampler of panna cotta, cream puff chantilly, chocolate
just my wife and I. was a quiet night but had a lot of fun. great place

column4: 4404 Old Redwood Hwy Santa Rosa, CA  95403
column13: Wine manager Anthony selected several excellent bottles based upon our suggestions with respect to desired characteristics.

OpenTable and website said they opened for Brunch on Sundays at 10:30am (apparently only true during the summer-we went during winter). I first booked the reservation on OpenTable and it forced me into an 11:30am slot, but I wanted 11am. I called the restaurant and they happily changed the reservation to 11am and sent me a written confirmation. We arrived at 10:50am and were told we would have to wait until 11:30am because they weren't open yet. They should have offered us a complimentary glass of champagne for the inconvenience but didn't. Waiter was friendly and efficient but Eggs Benedict arrived cold (other tables were sending theirs back to the kitchen as well). No apologies for the cold food either. Better for dinner...

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Great food + great service = a winner ... They have karaoke booths that I still have to try out with friends so I will have to come back :)
Excellent service, delicious food.
This was our second trip to Yeti before we pack up and move back to Minnesota from Glen Ellen, CA. The food and atmosphere are great overlooking Sonoma Creek.

Yoshi's is also a jazz club - the best in the Bay Area. They always see to it that you make the show with time to spare. They also change the menu quite frequently so if you go often you do not get bored with the same things over and over. The restaurant overlooks the Oakland Railroad tracks and trains go by as you dine - quite charming. The trains never interfere with the concerts. One of my all time favorite places to go. Betsy Hausburg

Went there for dinner. The place was fairly empty and stayed that way throughout the entire time we were there. The appetizers were good but the entree's were pretty bad. I had the lamb shank and it was very dry! The roast quail tasted really gamey which is fine, but it just didn't do it for me. It wasn't the best meal, but it's a cozy atmosphere & I still had a decent time!
Most friendly waiters I have ever met.
As always, the grilled pear salad was an excellent starting point for the meal. I had the butternut squash soup, rather than French fries, with a turkey and havarti sandwich.

I took my parents here, who love NY style pizza (my dad is an NYC native) and they thoroughly enjoyed the Fillmore pizza. We sharrd the arugula salad along with the beet and chicory salad. The latter was EXCELLENT and the combined flavors were so unique. Oyr waiter was a little high strung, and not so personable. Service was ok and the food was delicious!
Better than any other Persian restaurant I've been to. As good as the best home-cooked Persian food.
Disappointing. Some time ago, the food had been much more interesting.

My husband and I loved this restaurant! It was our first time going and it was fabulous! I had the special for the night and my husband had the gnocchi con gamberi. The food was delicious and the service was awesome! Loved the atmosphere! After dinner we went to the jazz lounge enjoyed a glass of wine while listening to an amazing singer! We loved our overall experience!
Had reservation 6:30 pm but would not let us order from menu until 7:00 pm. Annoying and wasted time

Really good food, but the noise level is way beyond "energetic." It's just too loud to hear yourself think, let alone have a conversation with your dining companions. Bread was very late coming--we were told it was just out of the oven--but when it finally arrived it was stone cold. A minor thing: the olive oil for dipping is peppery to the point of bitterness; something more mild and fruity would be better.
